meanings.definition: Covered or concealed with a veil or covering.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious bride walked down the aisle in her velate gown.
meanings.sent2: The magician's velate trick amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The spy tried to blend in by wearing a velate disguise.
meanings.sent4: The forest was velate with fog, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The velate mask made the masquerade ball even more enchanting.

meanings.definition: Having a velum or velum-like structure.
meanings.sent1: The velate creature had a thin, translucent body.
meanings.sent2: The velate wings of the butterfly shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The scientist studied the velate tissue under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The jellyfish moved gracefully with its velate bell.
meanings.sent5: The velate petals of the flower seemed almost ethereal.

meanings.definition: To cover or wrap with a veil or covering.
meanings.sent1: She decided to velate the gift to keep it a surprise.
meanings.sent2: The artist velated the statue before the grand unveiling.
meanings.sent3: The prankster velated the chair with plastic wrap as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The chef velated the dish with a garnish of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent5: The wind velated the sand dunes, creating ever-shifting patterns.
